org.apache.flink.runtime.io.network.bufferprovider

Interface LocalBufferPoolOwner

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InputGate, RuntimeEnvironment

    public interface LocalBufferPoolOwner
    A local buffer pool owner is an object which initially retrieves its buffers from the GlobalBufferPool and manages its fraction of the overall buffer pool locally by means of a LocalBufferPool.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearLocalBufferPool()
      Clears the local buffer pool and returns all buffers to the global buffer pool.
      int getNumberOfChannels()
      Returns the number of byte-buffered channels that will retrieve their buffers from the local buffer pool.
      void logBufferUtilization()
      Logs the current status of the local buffer pool.
      void registerGlobalBufferPool(GlobalBufferPool globalBufferPool) 
      void reportAsynchronousEvent()
      Reports an asynchronous event.
      void setDesignatedNumberOfBuffers(int numBuffers)
      Sets the designated number of buffers the local buffer pool owner is allowed to fetch from the global buffer pool and manage locally by means of the LocalBufferPool.

    • Method Detail

      • getNumberOfChannels

        int getNumberOfChannels()
        Returns the number of byte-buffered channels that will retrieve their buffers from the local buffer pool.
        Returns:
        the number of byte-buffered channels that will retrieve their buffers from the local buffer pool

      • setDesignatedNumberOfBuffers

        void setDesignatedNumberOfBuffers(int numBuffers)
        Sets the designated number of buffers the local buffer pool owner is allowed to fetch from the global buffer pool and manage locally by means of the LocalBufferPool.
        Parameters:
        numBuffers - the numBuffers the local buffer pool owner is allowed to fetch from the global buffer pool

      • clearLocalBufferPool

        void clearLocalBufferPool()
        Clears the local buffer pool and returns all buffers to the global buffer pool.

      • registerGlobalBufferPool

        void registerGlobalBufferPool(GlobalBufferPool globalBufferPool)

      • logBufferUtilization

        void logBufferUtilization()
        Logs the current status of the local buffer pool. This method is intended mainly for debugging purposes.

      • reportAsynchronousEvent

        void reportAsynchronousEvent()
        Reports an asynchronous event. Calling this method interrupts each blocking method of the buffer pool owner and allows the blocked thread to respond to the event.
